app_path ( )

app_path()

Get the application's directory on the server

Returns:
the path to the directory where the application runs
build_menu_from_modules ( $  modules,
$  currentModule 
)

Builds a HTML menu based on the array received as parameter and will return it as a string

Parameters:
array$modulesarray to get menu entries from
string$currentModulename of the module not to wrap in tags
Returns:
string representing the menu's HTML code
csv_search ( $  fh,
$  column,
$  criteria 
)

Read line by line the file stored in $file_handle and search on the $column specified by $criteria.

The $column is the number of CSV separator + 1, example:

john|31

Here the CSV separator is | and "31" is on the second column, because it is found after the first separator

Parameters:
resource$fhfile stream for reading the comma separated values
int$columncolum to read the data from
string$criteriastring to be found
Returns:
the line as an array containing the $criteria if $criteria was found, otherwise FALSE
find_files_by_mime ( $  path,
$  mime,
$  recursive = TRUE 
)

Searches recursively in the path provided by $path the files which have the MIME type set to $mime

Parameters:
string$pathpath to a directory
string$mimeMIME type to be matched
bool$recursivesearch recursively or not in the provided directory
Returns:
array $files containing the the directory name as key and the path to the file as the value
render ( $  template,
$  vars = NULL 
)

Creates variables that are necessary for including the file specified by $template and includes it

Parameters:
string$templatepath to the file to be required
array$varsassociative array containing variable names needed by $template, default NULL(none)
Returns:
returns a status code, if it's the case that status coude is an error
return_bytes ( $  val)

Used to convert a shorthand notation like 2M in bytes. Please visit: http://www.php.net/manual/en/function.ini-get.php

Parameters:
string$valshortnotation (e.g. "2M")
Returns:
bytes representation of the shorthand notation
